text: The 1956 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented Fresno State CollegeCalifornia State University, Fresno was known as Fresno State College from 1949 to 1971. during the 1956 NCAA College Division football season. The team was led by fifth-year head coach Clark Van Galder and played home games at Ratcliffe Stadium on the campus of Fresno City College in Fresno, California. They finished the season with the best record in the CCAA, but no champion was named. The team had a record of eight wins and two losses (8–2, 2–0 CCAA). ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL/AFL== The following were selected in the 1957 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bill Murphy || End || 10 || 120 || Chicago Bears |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Darryl Rogers || Back || 24 || 280 || Los Angeles Rams |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Nick Brown || Guard || 27 || 324 || Chicago Bears |} The following finished their college career in 1956, were not drafted, but played in the AFL (prior to the merge with the NFL). {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || First AFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bob Garner || Defensive back || 1960 Los Angeles Chargers |} ==Notes== ==References== Fresno State Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Fresno State Bulldogs f
